text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section don't you sometimes think that
Thanksgiving is just one big excuse to
eat lots of stuffing my favorite
stuffing recipe is brown butter
cornbread stuffing and it happens to be
the easiest stuffing recipe I know first
you need some cornbread
you can buy cornbread or if you want you
can make cornbread use your favorite
recipe then just let it sit out so it
gets a little stale and crumble it into
large pieces then mix up your seasonings
in the bowl I'm gonna use two eggs to
bind it a lot of recipes have you saute
the aromatics before you add them to the
bread but I don't bother I like them raw
and it saves time I'm gonna use the
scallions minced sage a little bit of
chili powder and then salt and pepper
the crowning glory of this stuffing is
using brown butter instead of just
regular melted butter it's really easy
to make all you have to do is melt 6
tablespoons of butter and then you'll
hear it sizzling and as it's sizzles the
white milk solids on top are going to
kind of sink to the bottom and they're
gonna caramelize and get brown that's
where the flavor is
and now just add in half of your brown
butter now just mix everything together
I use my hands you see how this is nice
and moist this is what you want but if
your cornbread got really stale and it
looks a little dry this is the point
where you want to add in just a little
bit of water or you could use turkey
stock or vegetable stock now just pour
it into a casserole dish or I'm gonna
use the same skillet that I made the
cornbread in I don't even have to wash
it out or of course you could stuff it
in
then just drizzle the remaining brown
butter right on the top this makes it
nice and crispy now I'm going to bake
this at 350 for about 45 minutes and
then when you take its temperature the
stuffing should be at 165 yeah we
swapped it out but here you have it
brown butter cornbread stuffing it
really is the best part of Thanksgiving
